alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued November 30 at 6:09AM CST until November 30 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Henry County in southeastern Alabama... * Until 700 AM CST. * At 608 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Texasville to 10 miles south of Blue Springs State Park, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Barnes, Edwin, Hardwickburg, Otho, Hayes, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Murphy Station, Graball, Screamer, Coates, Thomas Mill Creek, Lawrenceville, Abbeville Municipal A/P and Willis Crossroads. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia.
